intro: Beringeria maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan beringia, is a rare and unique plant species native to the mountainous regions of Morocco. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Beringeria maroccana is considered a vulnerable species.
